Title: What does the new National Curriculum Framework (NCF) has for students?
Content:
The union ministry of education has launched a new National Curriculum Framework (NCF-2023) for school education in line with the National Education Policy 2020 (NEP). 

In addition to introducing a second board exam, this NCF-2023, which was announced on Aug 23, will change how IndiaтАЩs students go to school.

Prepared by the union ministry of education, NEP aims to overhaul IndiaтАЩs 36-year-old education policies.

Goodbye 10+2, Hello 5+3+3+4 

Under the New Education Policy (NEP), a 5 +3+3+4 format is replacing the 10+2 school format. A new set of textbooks will be developed for the 2024 academic session considering the changes. 

The first five years of schooling will now consist of three years of pre-primary school and the foundation stage, including Class 1 and Class 2. The focus in these years would be on play- and activity-based learning, including the development of language skills.

The next three years, Classes 3 through 5, will form the preparatory phase, where the learning will focus on further improving language skills, reading, writing, and speaking. The numeracy skills will also be in focus, combined with physical education and classroom interaction.

Middle School (Classes 6 through 8) will focus on critical learning, experiential science, humanities, arts, mathematics, social sciences, etc.

Classes 9 through 12, or Secondary School, will see students choose from an array of multidisciplinary courses aimed at developing critical thinking across subjects. Apart from this, Arts, Commerce, and Science streams will not be strictly followed in schools.

Students in Classes 11 and 12 are expected to learn two languages, including at least one Indian language.

More choice for students

Under NCF-2023, the academic year is now being split into semesters.

Students of Classes 9 and 10тАУas well as those of Classes 11 and 12тАУwill choose 16 courses or papers for the combined two years. Eight of these papers are to be cleared each year to be eligible for a certificate. This means that a Class 9 (or Class 11) student would choose 16 courses across disciplines and clear half of them while in Class 9 (or Class 11, as the case may be). The remaining eight papers will have to be cleared in Class 10 (or Class 12) in order to achieve a board certificate.  

Two board exams

In another interesting move, students will give board exams twice in the same year, and be allowed to keep the better of the two scores. 

To this end, school boards have been directed to develop the capacity to conduct тАЬon-demandтАЭ examinations at appropriate times.

Other changes with NCF in uniforms, assembly, and seating arrangements

NCF-2023 also addresses issues such as classroom seating, school assemblies, uniforms, language, and cultural integration within the education system.

For example, it suggests circular or semi-circular classroom seating, gender-neutral uniforms suited to the local climate, and meaningful rather than ritualistic and mechanical assemblies.

Title: IMA pulls back notification for mandatory generic drugs prescription
Content:
Doctors to now only prescribe generic medicines (img: Envato Elements)

The national medical commission (NMC) announced new rules in its тАШRegulations relating to the Professional Conduct of Registered Medical PractitionersтАЩ, which will make it mandatory for medical practitioners to prescribe generic medicines to patients. The doctors violating this rule will be fined and may even have their practising licence revoked for a while.

Updated on Aug 25, 12.45 p.m.

The newly-notified registered medical practitioner (professional conduct) regulations, 2023, by the national medical commission (NMC), has been temporary suspended by the union government.

The latest development come days after Indian medical association (IMA) had written to the Union health minister Mansukh Mandaviya raising serious concerns on the said regulations.

Earlier, IMA National President Sharad Kumar Agarwal attended the meeting convened by Mandaviya with all the stakeholders to discuss issues on the said regulations.

However, under the new rules, doctors have also been granted the right to choose not to treat a patient.

Mandatory for doctors to prescribe generic drugs

The new rules announced by the NMC on Aug 2 state that every registered medical practitioner (RMP) must prescribe medicines using legibly spelt generic names. If this rule is violated, the doctor may be issued a warning to be more careful. Workshops or academy programmes on ethics, personal and social relations, or professional training will also be organised for the implementation of this rule amongst doctors.

Although doctors must prescribe only generic drugs, the rules described by the Indian medical council (IMC) in 2002 did not include a penalty.

Doctors to not prescribe branded generic drugs too

The NMC has asked doctors to refrain from prescribing branded generic drugs as well.

Branded generic drugs are the ones that are not patented but are manufactured by drug companies. These drugs can be less expensive compared to branded patent versions of drugs.

Generic drugs 30-80% cheaper than branded drugs in India

The notification from the NMC stated that expenses on medicines take up a major chunk of the health care expenditure of the people in India. The NMC stated that generic drugs are 30-80% cheaper than branded drugs. Doctors prescribing generic drugs can therefore reduce healthcare costs.

Doctors can now refuse treatment in specific cases

The new rules implemented by the NMC also give doctors the right to refuse treatment to patients who show indecent or violent behaviour. Apart from this, doctors can refuse the treatment even if the medical fees are not paid, according to this rule.

Title: Afghan girls willing to study in Dubai barred from leaving country
Content:
Afghani girl studying (img: IANS)

Girls intending to continue their higher studies in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) were barred from travelling by the Taliban in Afghanistan on Aug 23.

According to reports, around 63 girls were turned away from travelling to Dubai after an Emirati businessperson arranged for them to study in the UAE.

Fundamentalism disrupts a flight and many futures

Dreams to fly quite literally came crashing down as many girls intending to continue their further studies at the University of Dubai had to cut short their dreams and trips after the Taliban in Afghanistan terminated their travel.

The girls had already been issued student visas by the UAEтАЩs foreign ministry for  their higher studies. It is noteworthy that the Taliban regime, which rules the country, has imposed sanctions on the higher education of women.

A Dubai-based businessman, Khalaf Ahmad Al Habtoor, sponsored this study programme for the girls in December 2022.

He had sponsored their university admission, accommodation, transportation, health insurance, and many other comprehensive services for their comfort and safety.

In this adversity, businessman Al Habtoor took to X to convey his dismay over it.

"I am unable to express the disappointment I feel now as the Afghan female students, whom I had provided an educational scholarship... were unfortunately unable to reach Dubai airport," he said on the microblogging site.

Afghanistan backpedals to three-decade-old gender norms

Ever since the enforced takeover of Afghanistan by the Talibani forces in August 2021, the country has taken a nosedive in terms of the prevalence of a harmonious environment for women.

The current regime had promised a relatively moderate approach to their fundamentalist governance as compared to the one in the 1990s. However, they have been putting restrictions on activities and undertakings concerning women.

Girls in the country have been barred from studying higher than sixth grade since last year. Restrictions are imposed on women from working and involving themselves in local and non-governmental organisations. Recreational activities have also been barred for women in public spaces.

Recently, United Nations (UN) employees were disallowed to work in the country in April this year.

The Talibani regime has faced condemnations and dissent on global levels; however, the forces have remained stern over their approach to governing the country, which comprises nearly two crore female population of the total 4.01 crore.

ркПрк▓рлЗркХрлНркЭрк╛ркирлНркбрк░ рк▓рк┐ркЯрк╡рк┐ркирлЗркирлНркХрлЛ: ркнрлВркдрккрлВрк░рлНрк╡ ркХрлЗркЬрлАркмрлА ркПркЬркирлНркЯ ркПрк▓рлЗркХрлНркЭрк╛ркирлНркбрк░ рк▓рк┐ркЯрк╡рк┐ркирлЗркирлНркХрлЛ рккрлБркдрк┐ркиркирк╛ рк╕рлМркерлА ркорлЛркЯрк╛ ркЯрлАркХрк╛ркХрк╛рк░рлЛркорк╛ркВркирк╛ ркПркХ рк╣ркдрк╛. ркдрлЗркгрлЗ рккрлБркдрк┐рки рккрк░ рккркдрлНрк░ркХрк╛рк░ркирлА рк╣ркдрлНркпрк╛ ркХрк░рк╡рк╛ркирлЛ ркЖрк░рлЛркк рк▓ркЧрк╛рк╡рлНркпрлЛ рк╣ркдрлЛ. 2006ркорк╛ркВ рк▓ркВркбркиркирлА ркПркХ рк╣рлЛркЯрк▓ркорк╛ркВ ркЭрлЗрк░рлА ркЪрк╛ рккрлАркзрк╛ ркмрк╛ркж ркдрлЗркоркирлБркВ ркорлГркдрлНркпрлБ ркеркпрлБркВ рк╣ркдрлБркВ. рккрлЛрк▓рлАрк╕рлЗ ркЬркгрк╛рк╡рлНркпрлБркВ рк╣ркдрлБркВ ркХрлЗ рк▓рк┐ркЯрк╡рк┐ркирлЗркирлНркХрлЛркирлЗ ркПрклркПрк╕ркмрлА ркПркЬркирлНркЯрлЛ ркЖркирлНркжрлНрк░рлЗ рк▓рлБркЧрлЛрк╡рлЛркИ ркЕркирлЗ ркжрк┐ркорк┐ркдрлНрк░рлА ркХрлЛрк╡ркдрлБрки ркжрлНрк╡рк╛рк░рк╛ ркЭрлЗрк░ ркЖрккрк╡рк╛ркорк╛ркВ ркЖрк╡рлНркпрлБркВ рк╣ркдрлБркВ. рккрлБркдрк┐ркирлЗ ркЖ ркорк┐рк╢рки рккрк╛рк░ рккрк╛ркбрк╡рк╛ ркорк╛ркЯрлЗ ркмркВркирлЗ ркПркЬркирлНркЯрлЛркирлЗ ркорлЛркХрк▓рлНркпрк╛ рк╣ркдрк╛.

ркПркирк╛ рккрлЛрк▓рк┐ркЯркХрлЛрк╡рк╕рлНркХрк╛ркпрк╛: рк░рк╢рк┐ркпрки рккркдрлНрк░ркХрк╛рк░ ркПркирк╛ рккрлЛрк▓рк┐ркЯркХрлЛрк╡рк╕рлНркХрк╛ркпрк╛ркП ркдрлЗркоркирк╛ рккрлБрк╕рлНркдркХ  Putin's Russia ркорк╛ркВ, рк░рк╢рк┐ркпрки рк░рк╛рк╖рлНркЯрлНрк░рккркдрк┐ рккрк░ ркжрлЗрк╢ркирлЗ рккрлЛрк▓рлАрк╕ рк╕рлНркЯрлЗркЯркорк╛ркВ рклрлЗрк░рк╡рк╡рк╛ркирлЛ ркЖрк░рлЛркк ркорлВркХрлНркпрлЛ ркЫрлЗ. ркЖ рк╡рк╛ркдркерлА рк░рк╢рк┐ркпрки рк╕рк░ркХрк╛рк░ ркирк╛рк░рк╛ркЬ ркеркИ ркЧркИ рк╣ркдрлА ркЕркирлЗ ркдрлНркпрк╛рк░ркмрк╛ркж 2006ркорк╛ркВ рк╕рлБрккрк╛рк░рлА ркХрлАрк▓рк░рлНрк╕рлЗ ркдрлЗркоркирлА рк╣ркдрлНркпрк╛ ркХрк░рлА ркжрлАркзрлА рк╣ркдрлА. ркЖ рк╣ркдрлНркпрк╛ ркорк╛ркЯрлЗ рккрк╛ркВркЪ рк▓рлЛркХрлЛркирлЗ ркжрлЛрк╖рк┐ркд рккркг ркарлЗрк░рк╡рк╡рк╛ркорк╛ркВ ркЖрк╡рлНркпрк╛ рк╣ркдрк╛. рккрк░ркВркдрлБ ркХрк╣рлЗрк╡рк╛ркп ркЫрлЗ ркХрлЗ ркЖ рк▓рлЛркХрлЛркирлЗ рк╣ркдрлНркпрк╛ ркорк╛ркЯрлЗ ркПркХ ркХрк░рлЛркб рк░рлВрккрк┐ркпрк╛ ркорк│рлНркпрк╛ рк╣ркдрк╛.

Title: UAE, Saudi Arabia among six nations to join BRICS group in 2024
Content:
The BRICS grouping announced today that six nationsтАФ Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Argentina, the UAE, and Saudi Arabia, will be included as full time members.

South Africa president Cyril Ramaphosa announced this at the BRICS summit.

The membership will be effective from January 1, 2024.

BRICS welcomes the new members

тАЬWe have consensus on the first phase of this BRICS expansion process,тАЭ Ramaphosa told reporters in Johannesburg.

These six nations will join Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa.

Speaking immediately after RamaphosaтАЩs announcement, PM Narendra Modi, who is in Johannesburg to attend the BRICS Summit, welcomed all six nations and vowed to work with the other nations to continue adding nations that express interest in joining.

тАЬI take this opportunity to welcome these six nations to BRICS... and I congratulate the leaders and people of these nations. India has close ties, historic ties, with each of these countries and I believe we will work together for a new era of cooperation and prosperity,тАЭ PM Modi said.

тАЬOn the occasion of the 15th anniversary of BRICS, we have taken the decision to expand this forum. India has always fully supported this expansion. Such an expansion will make BRICS stronger and more effective. In that spirit, India welcomes Argentina, Egypt, Ethiopia, Iran, Saudi Arabia and UAE into the BRICS family,тАЭ he later said on X.

What does the BRICS do?

BRICS seeks to restructure the political and economic environment to give an advantage to its members with initiatives such as the BRICS Business Council.

Additionally, they formed the Contingent Reserve Agreement, designed to offer short-term financial support, and the New Development Bank, which funds development projects within BRICS nations.

Currently, the member nations are even thinking about their own, BRICS currency, that they can trade, invest, and exchange among the member nations, decreasing the dependability on the dollar. 

(Source: IANS)

ркЖрклрлНрк░рк┐ркХрки ркжрлЗрк╢ ркирк╛ркИркЬрлАрк░рк┐ркпрк╛ркорк╛ркВ ркХркЯрлНркЯрк░рк╡рк╛ркжрлА рк╕ркВркЧркаркирлЛ ркЫрк╛рк╢рк╡рк╛рк░рлЗ ркЖркдркХ ркоркЪрк╛рк╡ркдрк╛ рк░рк╣рлЗ ркЫрлЗ. рк╣рк╡рлЗ ркирк╛ркИркЬрлАрк░рк┐ркпрк╛ркирк╛ ркмрлЛрк░рлНркирлЛ ркирк╛ркоркирк╛ рк░рк╛ркЬрлНркпркорк╛ркВ ркХркЯрлНркЯрк░рк╡рк╛ркжрлАркУркП рк╣рлБркорк▓рлЛ ркХрк░рлАркирлЗ 42 ркорк╣рк┐рк▓рк╛ркУркирлБ ркЕрккрк╣рк░ркг ркХрк░рлАркирлЗ рк╣рк╛рк╣рк╛ркХрк╛рк░ ркоркЪрк╛рк╡рлА ркжрлАркзрлЛ ркЫрлЗ.

рк╕рлНркерк╛ркирк┐ркХ рк▓рлЛркХрлЛркП ркорлАркбрк┐ркпрк╛ркирлЗ ркЖ ркЬрк╛ркгркХрк╛рк░рлА ркЖрккркдрк╛ ркХрк╣рлНркпрлБ рк╣ркдрлБ ркХрлЗ, ркЖ ркорк╣рк┐рк▓рк╛ркУ ркЧрлНрк░рк╛ркорлНркп рк╡рк┐рк╕рлНркдрк╛рк░ркорк╛ркВ рк▓рк╛ркХркбрк╛ ркнрлЗркЧрк╛ ркХрк░рлА рк░рк╣рлА ркдрлНркпрк╛рк░рлЗ ркХрлНркЯрлНркЯрк░рк╡рк╛ркжрлАркУркП рк╣рлБркорк▓рлЛ ркХрк░рлНркпрлЛ рк╣ркдрлЛ.

ркЖ рк╕рлНркерк│ ркЖркдркВркХрлА рк╕ркВркЧркарки ркмрлЛркХрлЛ рк╣рк░рк╛ркоркирлЛ ркЧркв ркоркирк╛ркп ркЫрлЗ. ркЬрлЗ ркЫрлЗрк▓рлНрк▓рк╛ 24 рк╡рк░рлНрк╖ркерлА ркирк╛ркИркЬрлАрк░рк┐ркпрк╛ркирк╛ ркЕркорлБркХ рк╡рк┐рк╕рлНркдрк╛рк░ркорк╛ркВ рк╕ркХрлНрк░рк┐ркп ркЫрлЗ. ркЬрлЗркоркирлБ ркЕрккрк╣рк░ркг ркХрк░рк╛ркпрлБ ркЫрлЗ ркдрлЗ ркорк╣рк┐рк▓рк╛ркУ рк░рк╛рк╣ркд ркЫрк╛рк╡ркгрлАркорк╛ркВ рк░рк╣рлЗ ркЫрлЗ ркЕркирлЗ рк▓рк╛ркХркбрк╛ рк╡рлЗркЪрлАркирлЗ рккрлЛркдрк╛ркирлБ ркЧрлБркЬрк░рк╛рки ркЪрк▓рк╛рк╡рлЗ ркЫрлЗ. рк╕рлНркерк╛ркирк┐ркХ рк╡рк╣рк┐рк╡ркЯрлАркдркВркдрлНрк░ркирлБ ркХрк╣рлЗрк╡рлБ ркЫрлЗ ркХрлЗ, ркоркВркЧрк│рк╡рк╛рк░рлЗ ркмркирлЗрк▓рлА ркШркЯркирк╛ркирлА ркЬрк╛ркгркХрк╛рк░рлА ркмрлБркзрк╡рк╛рк░рлЗ ркорлЛркбрлА рк░рк╛ркдрлНрк░рлЗ ркорк│рлА рк╣ркдрлА.

ркЖ ркорк╣рк┐рк▓рк╛ркУ рк╣ркЬрлА рккркг ркХркЯрлНркЯрк░рк╡рк╛ркжрлАркУркирк╛ ркХркмрлНркЬрк╛ркорк╛ркВ ркЫрлЗ. ркжрк░рлЗркХ ркорк╣рк┐рк▓рк╛ркирлЗ ркЫрлЛркбрк╡рк╛ ркорк╛ркЯрлЗ ркдрлЗркоркгрлЗ 50000 ркирк╛ркпрк░рк╛ (ркирк╛ркИркЬрлАрк░рк┐ркпрки ркЪрк▓ркг)ркирлА ркорк╛ркВркЧркгрлА ркХрк░рлА ркЫрлЗ. рк╕рлНркерк╛ркирк┐ркХ рк▓рлЛркХрлЛ ркорк╣рк┐рк▓рк╛ркУркирлЗ ркЫрлЛркбрк╛рк╡рк╡рк╛ ркорк╛ркЯрлЗ рк╡рк╛ркдркЪрлАркд ркХрк░рлА рк░рк╣рлНркпрк╛ ркЫрлЗ.

Title: ICC World Cup 2023 tickets sale goes live: Check out the whole schedule
Content:
ICC World Cup 2023 poster (img: ICC)

The wait is finally over with the long awaited dates for buying the ICC Cricket World Cup tickets being announced. The ticket sales for the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 will go live on Aug 25 in various phases, with the final phase going live on Sept 15.

Updated on Aug 25, 5 p.m.

Ticket sales for non-India matches for all the stadiums commence from today. Tickets for matches at Lucknow's BRSABV Ekana Cricket Stadium are to be sold at the cheapest starting price of тВ╣499.

Tickets in Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi stadium are to be sold starting from тВ╣500 from Sept 3 for Indian matches.

Cricket enthusiasts will have to register on the ICC official website before buying the match tickets online.

Gujarat will be painted in cricketing colours this year as the much-awaited ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 commences on Oct 5 from the Narendra Modi stadium in Ahmedabad. For the first time, the whole tournament will  be hosted solely by India.

The matches are scheduled in the festive season which is also when a lot of NRIs are expected. тАЬI am trying to buy tickets in such a way that I can be there for Navratri too and watch the Indo-Pak match on Oct 14,тАЭ says Manish Patel, an IT professional from St Louis, Missouri. While Aditya Pattani, a student in  Mississauga says, тАЬBefore the ticket prices go up, I will need to arrange my leaves and book flight tickets as soon as possible. In fact, I am planning to get tickets to whichever location I can get to.тАЭ

Indian games at Ahmedabad to go live on Sept 3

Tickets for Indian games to be played in Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi stadium will go live on Sept 3.

India will be playing the tournament's hottest clash - IND vs PAK on Oct 14 (according to the revised date).

Ticket sales for all non-India games to go live on Aug 25

Tickets for all the matches being played by teams other than India, including the warm-up games, will go live on Aug 25.

Fans would be able to avail tickets for the tournament opener in Ahmedabad - ENG vs NZ on Oct 5, or the arch-rivals clashing, ENG vs AUS on Nov 4 in Ahmedabad.

IndiaтАЩs games at Chennai, Delhi, and Pune to go live on Aug 31

Tickets for the three venues - Chennai, Delhi, and Pune will go live on Aug 31.

India will be kicking off its World Cup campaign at the Chepauk stadium in Chennai against Australia on Oct 8.

India will lock horns against Afghanistan on Oct 11 in Delhi. Other than that, we will play Bangladesh, on Oct 19 in Pune.

Indian matches at Dharamsala, Lucknow, and Mumbai to go live on Sept 1

Tickets for the Indian games played at Dharamsala, Lucknow and Mumbai will go live on Sept 1.

On Oct 22, India will face cricketing giants NZ in Dharamsala. India will be facing the defending champions, England, at Lucknow on Oct 29. India will play against Sri Lanka on Nov 2 at MumbaiтАЩs Wankhede stadium, recreating the iconic  2011 World Cup final.

Indian matches at Bengaluru and Kolkata to go live on Sept 2

Indian games to be played in Bengaluru and Kolkata will go live on Sept 2.

India will clash against South Africa on Nov 5 at Kolkata's Eden Gardens.

India will be facing the latest qualified team, the Netherlands in the last match-up of the tournament at Bengaluru on Nov 8.

Semi-Finals and Final tickets to go live on Sept 15

Tickets for the three knockout games of the 2023 cricket World Cup will go live on Sept 15.

The first semi-final game is scheduled to be played on Nov 15 at Wankhede stadium between the first and fourth-ranking teams in the tournament's points table.

The second semi-final will be played on Nov 16 at Eden Gardens between the second and third-placed teams.

The final will be played at Narendra Modi stadium on Nov 19, between the two winners of the semi-finals.

Indian warm-up games to go live on Aug 30

Tickets for the 10 warm-up games for the ICC Cricket World Cup 2023 will go live on Aug 30.

They will be played in Guwahati, Thiruvananthapuram, and Hyderabad.

India will be playing a warm-up against England on Sept 30 at Guwahati and a qualifier team at Thiruvananthapuram on Oct 3.

Title: Neeraj Chopra enters World Athletics Championships final, seals 2024 Paris Olympic qualification
Content:
Reigning Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra began his World Athletics Championships campaign in style today in Budapest as he qualified for menтАЩs javelin throw final with a season best of 88.77m and sealed qualification for 2024 Paris Olympics.

The season-best distance of 88.77m saw Chopra breaching Paris Olympic qualification mark of 85.50m. The qualification for the Paris 2024 Olympics for track and field athletes began on July 1, 2023.

The Indian national record holder sent the spear to his seasonтАЩs and fourth career-best distance in his very first attempt while competing in Qualification Group A.

A total of 37 javelin throwers, divided into two groups - A and B - are competing in the qualifiers for a place in the 12-man final, scheduled on Aug 27. The automatic qualifying mark is 83.00m.

Those who throw 83m or the top-12 best performers from both Group A and B qualify for the final.

The 25-year-old entered the championships as the worldтАЩs top-ranked javelin thrower and was eyeing that elusive gold medal both for his personal medals cabinet and the country.

Chopra came close to becoming the first Indian world champion in any athletics discipline at the 2022 world championships in Oregon but eventually had to settle for a silver medal after finishing behind GrenadaтАЩs Anderson Peters.

Another Indian DP Manu, who won the silver at the Asian Athletics Championships this year in Bangkok, started off with 78.10m and made a better throw in his second attempt to jump to third in Group A with an 81.31m throw.

However, his qualification will be confirmed after the conclusion of Group B, where another Indian Kishore Jena will be in action, scheduled later in the day.

(Source: IANS)

Title: Another Hindenburg? Soros-backed group gears up for Indian corporate expos├й!
Content:
Months after Hindenburg Research, the US-based short seller, released a report on the Adani Group, the Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project (OCCRP), funded by George Soros and Rockefeller Brothers Fund, is preparing to reveal another тАШexposeтАЩ about some Indian companies, stated a news agency. 

OCCRP is a global network of investigative journalists which тАЬis formed by 24 nonprofit investigative centres... spread across Europe, Africa, Asia and Latin America,тАЭ may publish a report or a series of articles, three sources with knowledge of the matter informed the agency.

Sources said the тАШexposeтАЩ may involve overseas funds investing in the stocks of the corporate house. The identity of the corporate house wasn't immediately known but agencies are said to be keeping a tight vigil on the capital market, stated the report.  

An email sent to OCCRP seeking comments by the news agency PTI remained unanswered.

What to expect from OCCRP?

Founded in 2006, OCCRP claims to specialise in reporting on organised crime and largely publishes these news articles through partnerships with media houses.

On its website, OCCRP identifies Open Society Foundations of George Soros, as one of its institutional donors. Others include Ford Foundation, Rockefeller Brothers Fund and Oak Foundation.

The Adani-Hindenburg row

The Hindenburg Research that came out seven months ago, accused Adani Group of stock manipulation and improper use of tax havens. Stock market of the group tumbled that erased close to USD 150 billion in the market value at its lowest point.

Adani Group has denied all allegations.
